files.description: Dockerfile for a minimal, reproducible execution environment that runs the smoke test and produces captured logs and artifacts for debugging container health issues.
Docker Compose configuration to run the smoke test in a controlled container with configurable resource limits, volumes for artifacts, and environment overrides.

errors.detail:
FILE_WRITTEN:docker/docker-compose.yml
DIR_STATE:["docker/docker-compose.yml"]
Summary: Wrote a Docker Compose configuration that builds and runs the smoke test container with bind-mounted workspace, dedicated artifacts/log volumes, configurable resource limits, and environment overrides.

FILE_WRITTEN:docker/docker-compose.yml
DIR_STATE:["docker/docker-compose.yml"]
Summary: Added a Docker Compose service that runs the smoke test in a controlled container with configurable resources, env overrides, artifact volumes, and a basic healthcheck.

files.description: Container entrypoint that initializes directories, invokes the smoke test with consistent defaults, and ensures logs/artifacts are persisted to mounted volumes.

errors.detail:

SUMMARY:Wrote a Docker entrypoint that initializes run/log/artifact directories, runs the smoke test with consistent defaults, captures full output to persistent logs, and mirrors artifacts to mounted output paths.

FILE_WRITTEN:docker/entrypoint.sh
DIR_STATE:["docker/docker-compose.yml", "docker/entrypoint.sh"]
Summary: Wrote a robust docker/entrypoint.sh that initializes output directories, snapshots runtime environment, runs the smoke test with consistent defaults, and escalates when essential artifacts are missing.

files.description: Documentation describing how to run the container-health smoke test locally and via Docker, interpret logs, configure retries/backoff, and reproduce the minimal failing case.

missionDescription: Add container-health instrumentation and a reproducible minimal failing case: run a single-file smoke test with full stdout/stderr capture; log runtime environment + resource stats; implement retries/backoff and a hard escalation rule when execution artifacts are missing.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Stabilizing the recurring 'container lost' failure is a prerequisite for any rubric-driven QA/review workflow: without reliable execution, you canâ€™t generate the artifacts needed for escalation trigge...
